meanings.definition: To lower in quality or value
meanings.sent1: The dishonest seller tried to debaser the price of the old car.
meanings.sent2: She knew that using cheap materials would debaser the quality of the product.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf decided to debaser the taste of the cookies by adding too much salt.
meanings.sent4: His negative attitude seemed to debaser the mood of the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The rain threatened to debaser the delicate sandcastle they had built.

meanings.definition: One who lowers in quality or value
meanings.sent1: The art critic labeled him as a debaser of traditional painting techniques.
meanings.sent2: She saw him as a debaser of the family name with his reckless behavior.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he was the debaser of all office potlucks with his strange food choices.
meanings.sent4: In the story, the villain was portrayed as the debaser of happiness in the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The gossip columnist was known as the debaser of reputations in the small town.
